trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of claims that are associated with an entity.
After the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> class has been created, it cannot be changed.
Examining the content of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> for particular types of claims is a common task when using claim-based authorization.
To examine a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> for the presence of particular claims, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.FindClaims%2A> method.
The method provides better performance than iterating directly over the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> class.
Reserved for future use.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> contains the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref>.
To find the specified claim, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.FindClaims%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> for which to search.
`true` if the specified claim is contained in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>; otherwise `false`.

Determines whether the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> contains the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref>, by using the specified <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer`1"></xref> object.
To find the specified claim, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.FindClaims%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> for which to search.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer`1"></xref> object used to make the comparison.
`true` if the specified claim is contained in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>; otherwise `false.`
When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of claims in this claim set.
To get an individual claim, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Item%2A> property.
The number of claims in this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, searches for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that matches the specified claim type and rights in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
To determine if this <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> contains the claim without returning the claim, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.ContainsClaim%2A> method.
The URI of the right associated with the new claim.
Several rights are available as static properties of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights"></xref> class.

A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that enables you to enumerate the claims that matches the specified criteria.

When overridden in a derived class, gets a <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> that can be used to enumerate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators.
Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator.
Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> that can be used to enumerate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the entity that issued this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
The issuer of the claim set that is returned by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.System%2A> property is the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.DefaultClaimSet>.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> object that issued this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> for the specified index.
The index of the claim to be retrieved.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> at the specified index.
Gets a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> object that represents an application trusted issuer.

This type of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> object is typically used as the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Issuer%2A> property for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> that is issued by the current application.

For example, after an application authenticates a username and password, it creates a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> that represents the user with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Issuer%2A> property set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.System%2A>.
The system <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> object.
Gets a set of claims that contains Windows security identifiers.

This type of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> object is typically used as the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Issuer%2A> property for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> that is issued by the Windows.

For example, after an application authenticates a username and password using Windows authentication, it creates the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet> with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Issuer%2A> property set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet.Windows%2A>.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> that contains at least one claim of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes.Sid"></xref>.

Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> that can be used to enumerate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators.
Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator.
Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> that can be used to enumerate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref>.
